text: Richard Meier (born October 12, 1934) is an American abstract artist and architect. He is known for his geometric designs and for using the color white in his buildings. A winner of the Pritzker Architecture Prize in 1984, some of his more iconic buildings include the Barcelona Museum of Contemporary Art and the Getty Center in Los Angeles. == Museum == * Museum Bisazza ==References== ==Other websites== * Richard Meier official website Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:American architects Category:American artists Category:Businesspeople from Newark, New Jersey Category:Pritzker Architecture Prize winners
title: Richard Meier
